lst.name: sentence
lst.str: The communist-led Workers' Commissions recently rejected a call by its leadership for a general strike while the ruling Socialist Party's trade union arm, the General Workers' Union, has refused to demonstrate with the communists on May 1.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Bankers say tight-money policies have attracted an avalanche of foreign capital that is cashing in on the strong peseta and high interest rates and those funds, converted into pesetas, are swelling money supply still further.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: "The money supply should be back on track by the summer and we will begin to see lower interest rates," said Andres Trujillo, general manager of Hong Kong and Shanghai Banking Corp's Madrid branch.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: The communist-led Workers' Commissions recently rejected a call by its leadership for a general strike while the ruling Socialist Party's trade union arm, the General Workers' Union, has refused to demonstrate with the communists on May 1.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Bankers say tight-money policies have attracted an avalanche of foreign capital that is cashing in on the strong peseta and high interest rates and those funds, converted into pesetas, are swelling money supply still further.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: "The money supply should be back on track by the summer and we will begin to see lower interest rates," said Andres Trujillo, general manager of Hong Kong and Shanghai Banking Corp's Madrid branch.
